Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow. Late every day this week.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We signed Cici up for this daycare. It's on the other side of town. The traffic...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why didn't I think of this before? Did you know that there is a daycare center opening right here in this building?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is there really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now that I own the building, I'm looking for new sources of revenue. And a daycare center... Ha ha ha [laughing maniacally] Well I guess it's not an evil idea. It's just a regular idea. But there is no good laugh for a regular idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Welcome to the Sesame Avenue Daycare Center for infants and toddlers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aaah!

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Aaah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You remember my cousin Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Welcome children.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Were you painting in the dark?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait. Is this your place Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no. I like to think of it as a kids place. Would you like a tour?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't really think we need...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh... lets take the tour Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on. Here is the language skills and cognitive development area. These are English... uh... letters. [pause] I see you found out magical toy box Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: These are actually forks and knives from the break room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim! To you and me, maybe, but, come on! To a child's imagination that's Mr. Fork and Lieutenant Knife and... Ms. Fork.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And a soy sauce packet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh! That shouldn't have been in there. I'm embarrassed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't beat yourself up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We come fully equipped with a restroom. Feeding trough, play bucket, and room for a plant, in success.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who will be watching the children?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No one. The door locks from the outside. Escape is impossible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Prove it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Were going to head outside, give it a whirl. I just want to see how it works.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But I'll tell you this, if this works out, I think we're looking real good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I promise you, that door locks! [Jim closes the door]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What's something that you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is the worst! You are the worst! I hate looking at your face! I wanna smash it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what? I made a mistake. I committed corporate punishment. My bad. It's over. It's done. But my punishment is ... um ... worse than hell.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael has been assigned six hours of mandatory counseling with a trained professional. I actually have a degree in social work. I mean, I know a lot of people would ask a few standard questions, and check off a few boxes, but I've got a chance to do some good here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know what you want to ask me. "Did your mom ever see you naked?"

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: We can do this with more privacy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you can molest me? Oh, ok. I don't think so. We're going to leave the blinds open so every one can see what a big failure you are. That's the key.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Boycott the Steamtown Mall! Everyone, you heard me! Cancel all of your business with the Steamtown Mall!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: The mall itself or just the stores in the mall?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All of it! The mall, the stores, the kiosks!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: America is one big mall.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did something happen Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, something happened. Oh yeah, something happened, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, tell us what it is. I mean, it would help us to get some context so we can get on board.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't want to know.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'd like you to imagine a place where you feel very peaceful. For me, it's the walk from the yogurt shop to my car after I drop my daughter off on Sunday afternoons.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm glad Michael is getting help. He as a lot of issues, and he's stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] Look, I'm not going to tell you that we have lower prices. Is price something that is important to you? Ok, well let me know if anything changes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't do this. I don't have this sales gene, or whatever it is. Tell me everything is going to be ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Everything is going to be ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tell me I'm good at sales.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're good... you're good at sales.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The unfair thing about working in sales is that your salary is almost all commission. So, you suck at sales, you make almost no money. I guess that's fair.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you call all of my clients at the mall and cancel all my business while using the "F" word?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes I did. And I'm going to do the same with all of your clients.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No you will not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh yes I will! That mall is corrupt, ok! They're "appearance"ists!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, Dwight. We can't do that. So why don't you just tell us what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, what happened Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You guys know me. You know that I'm not one for fancy things, but there was this one thing. It was in a fancy store. And it caught the corner of my eye when I took Mose down to the Mall to get his blood pressure at the Rite-Aid. And I thought, you know, maybe I deserve this. You know, I had a great crop yield this fall...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I went to the store and I pressed the buzzer, and they looked right at me, and then they looked away. And then I pressed the buzzer again, and they started taking pictures of me on their mobile phones. I guess I'm not the kind of guy that's good enough for precious heirlooms.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You know what Dwight? You need to go back there, and you need to "Pretty Woman" their asses.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: We should start our own mall!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait. That's actually a really good idea Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What did I say?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I talk a lot, so I've learned to just tune myself out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, how about this? Instead of boycotting, you and I, together, go down to that store and we teach those snobs a lesson.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, you and I... and I. I'm going to come with you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you assume that I would automatically side with the rich snobby shop owner? [removes cuff link] How about now? [removes other cuff link] How about now? [removes tie clip] How about now?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh... what was your favorite flavor of...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One hour.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One hour. We've done one hour. Let's just speed this up, ok? Keep it moving. I want to do all six hours today.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ok, I can't count the hour if you don't talk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no! I know my rights! All I had to do was sit here for six hours. Do my time.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, it's up to me to check off the boxes, and I can't do that unless I honestly...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, do you have any idea how angry this is making me?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Tell me!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I think we might be about to maybe really get somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I will. I will talk alright. Be careful what you wish for Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Apparently there is a famous Hollywood movie from the 1980's, Beautiful Girl...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pretty Woman.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Apparently, it's one of the best revenge stories of all times, in which this sex worker, who is the antagonist... That can't be right. Andy? How does it...?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no. I want to hear you tell it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, Um... The sex worker is denied service at a fancy store because she does not look wealthy. She later returns dressed in all the "trappings" of extravagant wealth, but instead of going...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Julia Roberts goes into the store, and she's like," I was in here yesterday and you wouldn't help me." And the shop girl goes, "ok". And Julia Roberts goes," You girls work on commission, right?" And the girl is like,"Yeah", and Julia Roberts goes...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: "Big mistake! Huge!"

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was telling that... I was telling that.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How many paper supplies and ink cartridges to go with that? Ok, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Window treatment guy
Quote.Text: Who can I speak to in this office about saving on window treatments?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Window treatment guy
Quote.Text: Is one of you the office administrator?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [hesitates] I am. I am the office administrator!

Quote.Speaker: Window treatment guy
Quote.Text: Can I show you a few samples?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, we're not interested. We're not interested at all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There are a few ways to get promoted. One is to wait for an opening and apply for it. That's the main way. But this could work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby, can I really tell you anything?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, the other night, I was sitting at the table, eating my penis... I mean peas. That was weird. Aaaah... weird. I think that was ... I was probed. By an alien life form. An A.L.F. Alf, you know, I might have actually been probed by Alf. You might think he's a puppet. You never see the lower half. But there is a lower half.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Office Administrator. So when did this happen?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A few months ago. I was talking to someone at corporate, who isn't there anymore, and I think the paperwork just got lost in the shuffle. Can you believe that?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, totally. Well, congrats!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks! Yeah, so I'm just going to take care of things around the office and get paid a reasonable salary. You believe that, right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Totally, that's great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I get paid $40,000 per year.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Before me stands your coworker, Dwight Kurt Schrute. Dwight, show them all sides. Turn around. Now, today, we need your help turning Dwight into a gentleman.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A gentleman who is a rich snob who will go into shopping malls and drop huge amounts of cash on clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is he still doing his boycott?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, this is instead of the boycott. Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You shirt and tie are disgusto-barfo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Agreed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Maybe something not so monochromatic. Not so matching.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait. Less matching to appear more rich?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The glasses are a little... [Dwight drops glasses to the floor, stomps on them]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I liked them.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I thought they were kind of cute.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I liked them too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't see.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Say stuff like, "Good morning, Good Afternoon". People appreciate that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, I see you every day. Can I say "Good month?"

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm telling you how to do this man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If someone offers you a cocktail, accept, but keep your wits about you.

Quote.Speaker: Angel
Quote.Text: Please and thank you go a long way.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Copy. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in a cockney accent] I think he's got it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I was raised by wolves. I was 25 years old before I saw my first human being. Wait, is it a full moon tonight? [howls and growls like a werewolf]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Come on Michael. Those are all fake stories.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Yes. They are all fake stories. What sort of twisted mind would come up with weird stories like that? [pause] Three hours. We're half way done.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, do you have a second?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, as I am sure you know, for the past few months, I've been the Office Administrator. Since right before you guys took over.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Right, of course!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And, I haven't gotten paid yet. I'm not blaming you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just think somebody lost the paperwork.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh boy. Can you get every department head's signature on this so I can back this up to corporate?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. Absolutely. Right away.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know what Michael? You're right. You win. This is pointless. We're not getting anywhere. I got a bunch of fun stuff, in case my daughter ever comes over. Why don't we just run out the clock by playing games, drawing some pictures, talking?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [fanfare]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We present to you for your comments and approval, Dwight K. Shrute.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Go get 'em Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wish us luck!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight [snaps a picture with a disposable camera, then drops the camera in the trash can]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Disposable cameras are fun, although it does seem wasteful and you don't ever get to see your pictures. If it's an important even that you want to remember, I recommend using a real camera. But I don't care if I forget today.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: We can play something more complicated if you like.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is plenty complicated.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So you have played it before?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've played it once or twice with Jeff.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Who's Jeff?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jeff was my mother's boyfriend, who she married.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So, her husband, your stepdad?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, Yeah. I guess I never thought about it that way, though.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Did you guys do much stuff together?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know what? He took me to a baseball game once, I remember. It was weird though. They took the pitcher out of the game. I felt really bad, because the pitcher wasn't able to play with his friends anymore. But Jeff said that the manager was making a really good move, by taking the pitcher out. He really respected the manager.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's working. I'm doing it!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [coughs for attention]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My place tonight. Wear this. [motioning to his new outfit]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you have your card?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes. Don't forget the pipe.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Its really sad that your dog ran away. Why did it keep you from going to the park?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was afraid I would find him in the park, playing with another kid.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I guess that's why I thought he ran away in the first place. To find a kid he liked better.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Dogs don't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right. Why would a dog do that? That's silly.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I hear myself say it, it sounds ridiculous. But I've never said it out loud, so...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's very important for you to be liked, isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, lets not get too... This isn't a counseling session... Ok. Son of a gun. Son of a bitch. Wow! Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm just trying to help you Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You. Bitch. God! You're very helpful aren't you? You try to help everybody. Do you want to play another game?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I just want to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are good. But you know what? You can't help people. You couldn't help your marriage. You lose. I don't need your help. Nobody needs your help. Nobody wants it! You can't help anybody. I don't need your help! Am I going to make you cry?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [tossing forms at Michael] Just fill them out any way you want.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'll have Erin fax them back to corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You'll do. . . ok. Filled out. Good. Thank you doctor. Take two of these [giving Toby two middle fingers] and call me in the morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Michael, um... about three months ago, I was talking to... [Michael grabs form and signs it without reading.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There are a lot of one person departments here, so, there's a lot of department heads. But I'm off to a good start. Oh, man! If I could pull this off, it will be scam of all scams. And yet very helpful to everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: So, Corporate got your evaluations, and they want me to check, is that really how you feel about Michaels situation?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: That is not how it seems to me.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He seems fine.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You marked severe in all the categories, including at risk for homicidal behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Heh.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I saw a TLC show on Kate Walsh's home office. All corkboard.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Right in here?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Easily.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm back! Ha ha. Pam, perfect. I was hoping to talk to the office administrator about a little office administration problem.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But of course!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: The problem, unfortunately, is about the office administrator. I have gone through everything for the past three years. There is nothing that says you are the office administrator.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So weird that there is no paperwork.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: At all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Although, like, unlikely things happen all the time. My best friend, in High School, she went to Australia, Canberra I think, and she met this guy who lived only two streets away in America.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Pam, I don't want to accuse you of anything. I just want everything to be back the way it's supposed to be. Can you just admit... admit...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Admit what?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I don't want to say it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Say it.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Say that I'm lying or say that I have the job. Make a definitive statement, Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Statements of such nature, while they have their place, are overused in a competitive business environment.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great. Well, Let me know if you need a new chair, or anything that an Office Administrator can handle.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Will do... Can I get one of those name plates... that says Gabe Lewis?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure. Anything else?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll get it right away.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The first lesson of watching World Poker Tour at 2:00 AM, you play the opponent. Not the cards.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that what you were here for? A crystal wizard? I like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is a pewter wizard holding a crystal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait a second. You know you can't buy that now, right? And I can come back and get it for you later. But I'm saying right now, we can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Because I'm here for one thing. Revenge.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: Let me know if I can help you with anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me sir.

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was here yesterday, and you refused to wait on me.

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: I remember, yes. I'm terribly sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You work on commission, don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop, stop, stop.

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: No, we don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you just say you remember him?

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: Of course, but he looks much less threatening now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: We had a safety concern. Um... we very politely indicated that he'd be welcome back...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good Morning!

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: If he were in accordance with our dress policy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: But the blood stained hands...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was beet juice! I am a beet farmer idi...

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: I'm very sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good sir. I happen to have been working a very long day. When I came to you fine establishment. You are such a... I'm gonna... Ok. Listen. You can't treat... Thank you! Good morning sir!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Lets just go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You made a big mistake. Huge!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There it is. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aaah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: After you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [re-entering the store] I'll take the wizard!

Quote.Speaker: Salesman
Quote.Text: Oh, ok!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You forged them! You forged the forms!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You filled them in and faxed them yourself!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You remember that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, but you had me so worked up that I made a mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Unless part of you made that mistake on purpose.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't make a mistake on purpose, Toby! Then it is no longer a mistake... Gabe. He messed it up. He messed up the forms, I bet... [mimicking Gabe] "I mess everything up so I can fix it and keep my job! Bah! Good thing I'm here cause I do nothing. I make everybody nervous!" [normal voice] Ah, ok. Got your notebook? Alright. Alright, lets bang this out. Let's do it to it!
